newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican debtors say to stage hunger strike at IMF.
newsitem.headline: Mexican debtors say to stage hunger strike at IMF.

text.p: A Mexican debtors group said on Thursday they would stage a hunger strike this weekend at the International Monetary Fund in Washington to protest economic and banking sector polices in Mexico.

Gerardo Fernandez, head of the 3,000-strong National Debtors Assembly, told Reuters the protest would run from Saturday until Monday, when the annual meeting of the IMF ends. Finance Minister Guillermo Ortiz will head a Mexican government delegation to the IMF.
"We are going to protest the negative effects of macroeconomic policy," Fernandez said.

His debtor group is among the smallest but most belligerent of the debtor movements that have sprung up in Mexico since the country fell into economic crisis in 1994. Millions of Mexicans, facing sky-rocketing interest rates, were forced into default at the bank.
The government has launched debt relief schemes, but protest groups say the rates charged are still too high for most bank clients.

On Thursday, IMF Managing Director Michel Camdessus said the fund was satisified with Mexico's economic performance since it came to its rescue with $17.8 billion in 1995. He said the economy was on the mend.
